name: onshore natural gas field infrastructure production | onshore natural gas field infrastructure | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/3433/documentation

This activity represents the construction of an onshore production field for extraction of natural gas. Lifetime 20 years.;For onshore production, several hundred production sites (wells) are summarized to one production field. The inventory is estimated for a site of 7500m2, which is described in more detail in Schori & Frischknecht (2012) and Jungbluth (2007). Oil and gas processing are done centrally, which requires pipes and pumps.;Onshore production requires space for pumps, separators, tanks, pipes, energy generation (for internal electricity production) as well as cleaning processes (particularly wastewater treatment).;Meili et al. (2021, section 6.4) assume that the lifetime of the land use change is only 20 instead of the formerly estimated 30 (oil) or 50 (gas) years. This assumption is based on analysis done for horizontal wells in Oklahoma US.;Reference(s): C. Meili, N. Jungbluth, M. Bussa (2021) Life cycle inventories of crude oil and natural gas extraction. ESU-services Ltd. commissioned by the Federal Office for the Environment (FOEN) and the â€œVerband der Schweizerischen Gasindustrie (VSG), Schaffhausen, Switzerland, DOI: 10.13140/RG.2.2.29142.78409, http://esu-services.ch/data/public-lci-reports/

This activity starts with the transformation of land (forest assumed).

Materials for construction and energy use for construction. Land use and transformation. Drilling of the wells is not included and hence considered separately. Manufacturing of facilities partly not included.
category: B:Mining and quarrying/06:Extraction of crude petroleum and natural gas/062:Extraction of natural gas/0620:Extraction of natural gas

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Material requirements is 1989 data, average production of field 1992 data.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The production pro field comes from Dutch data, the material requirements from German data.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Data assume 100 drilling holes pro field with a distance of 300m from a comb-like collecting pipe.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Applied to all onshore operations. Data vary considerable depending on infrastructure necessary to access the place of production. No data for Middle East. It is assumed that the lifetime of the land use change is only 20 instead of the formerly estimated 30 (oil) or 50 (gas) years. This assumption is based on analysis done for horizontal wells in Oklahoma US. Here, more than half of the production of oil and gas, which is projected for the total lifetime occurs during the first three years of operation. A lifetime of 20 years might be too low for exceptionally large oil fields, such as Rumaila in Iraq. Therefore, by using this estimate, the impact of land use might be slightly underestimated for the dataset for Iraq. However, for most of the globally accessible, smaller fields, this estimate seems appropriate. (Meili et al. 2021, section 6.4)
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Publication in environmental reports and other literature. The inventory is estimated for a field with 100 drilling sites and described in more detail in Schori & Frischknecht (2012) and Jungbluth (2007).
